response.answer_text: Depends where. In many countries it is alive and well. There are a lot of democracies that used to suffer from political extremism, coups, and ruthlessly violent military dictatorships. Having looked into the jaws of hell, most citizens in those countries now try to find agreeable ways to deal with issues of power. Spain only became a functioning democracy in 1975, and Spanish politicians are careful to maintain good relations with the military.
